title: Seven-Story Tribeca House Headed to Market for $15 Million
text:
A seven-story Tribeca townhouse will be hitting the market Wednesday for $15 million, Mansion Global has learned.



The home was designed by the 20th century pioneer of Tribeca's modernization, John L. Petrarca, according to listing agent Brandon Trentham, who shares the listing with his Compass colleagues Yoon Hoshue, Jill Camac and Lauren Feldesman.



More: Second Penthouse at 108 Leonard in Manhattan Lists for $9.15 Million

Petrarca was “an architect who brought a modern sensibility to the old blocks of Tribeca,” according to his 2003 obituary in the New York Times.



The newspaper referred specifically to the Petrarca-designed row of three houses that includes this property on Reade Street, noting that they “evoke 19th-century loft buildings with red bricks, sweeping stone arches, multi-pane windows and cornices. Yet they are also clearly contemporary, with broad expanses of glass and exposed steel beams.”



The owners, Michael George and Elaine Pang, who are both in finance, bought the house in 2005 for $7.4 million, property records show.



“When we moved in, we spent two-and-a-half years gutting it and upgrading everything to our standard,” Mr. George said in an email. “Among the larger jobs we did, we took off the wall at the top of the stairs and replaced it with a structural glass wall. Above it, we installed a steel spa; in the basement, we built a drainage system, installed false walls with old bricks and put in a zinc roof.”



They also air-conditioned the basement vaults to create a proper wine cellar, he said.

Other notable features in the five-bedroom home include a sundeck that holds the stainless steel hot tub and has 360-degree views of the city, an elevator, an Italian marble and iron spiral staircase with a motion-activated lighting system, a balcony, a time-controlled fish tank and custom closets and cabinetry throughout.



A townhouse in Tribeca is somewhat of a rarity. In fact, StreetEasy shows there is just one other townhouse currently on the market in the tony neighborhood.
